channel.title: Doepfer USB 64 for control interface
channel.description: I am new to the community, just got my board. I am looking to use the platform in two ways. To use with my EMS Synthis (that will be board #2) the thing I current want to get started on is to fly out as many common controls to a console for ease of use, that is lin line with mypersonal work flow. I have not seen any refernces to the Doepfer USB 64 encoder interface. I would be interested to know if anyone has tried using one. I have had some success using them with IOS devices and and hoping that I could use it to devirtualise Axoloti for my ease of use.

item.title: Doepfer USB 64 for control interface
item.dc:creator: @kassu
item.description:
@kassu wrote:

I have no experience with the USB64, but looking at doepfers website there is no reason it shouldn't work:

  • USB connection with axoloti as host should work, USB64 claims to be class compliant and if it works on iOS it is surely class complient.
  • Hardware midi cable to axoloti MIDI in should also definitely work.

Anyway, if you have the stuff already, just plug it in and try!

Read full topic
